text: Michael L. Morano (October 16, 1915-May 7, 2000) was an American politician and businessman. Morano was born in Greenwich, Connecticut. He was the owner of a car dealership in Greenwich. He served in the Connecticut House of Representatives from 1960 to 1976 and in the Connecticut Senate from 1976 to 1988. Morano was a Republican. Morano died at his home in Greenwich, Connecticut.Connecticut General Assembly Joint Resolution No. 40, January Session 2001-Death of Michael L. Morano of Greenwich, Connecticut'GOP's Morano, 84, Was Advocate For Safe Highways,' Lynne Tuohy, The Hartford Courant (Connecticut), May 10, 2000Connecticut State Library-Connecticut General Assembly members ==Notes== Category:1915 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Greenwich, Connecticut Category:Connecticut Republicans Category:Members of the Connecticut House of Representatives Category:Connecticut state senators Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Michael L. Morano
